title: Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Details, Chenonceaux and Beaulieu", June 19–20, 1888
medium: Graphite on thick off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 56; bottom right corner: 49; clockwise from upper left of sheet: Chapel Cupola / Chenonceaux; Dormer / Chenonceaux; Corner house at Beaulieu - near Loches / two turrets / June 20th 1888 / plan; Chenonceaux June 19th 1888.
description: Vertical sheet illustrating six sketches of buildings or architectural ornaments from Chenonceaux and Beaulieu.  The upper half of the sheet contains four drawings.  From left is a Renaissance style cupola consisting of three arcaded loggias culminating in a cross finial.  The lowest loggia has the tallest arches, between which can be seen a bell. To the right of this is a small sketch of a window and dormer, the dormer having a very high projecting pediment and small flame-like finials on top of it and to the left and right.  To the right of this is a very elaborate dormer, its upper windowed section supported at left and right by two cusped, round-arched buttresses.  Above this is a very small drawing of a cupola and its finial.  The bottom half of the sheet illustrates two complete buildings as opposed to their elements.  At bottom left is a large tower consisting of a group of turrets massed together.  At right is a house seen from the corner, a single turret visible at the left corner, and the peaked roof another seen at right.  A small plan of this structure is drawn below the elevation.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Details, Chenonceaux and Beaulieu", June 19–20, 1888.Graphite on thick off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-222.
